intro: Galium maborasense, commonly known as the Mabora bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry berries that contain several seeds. Galium maborasense is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories.
